# The `Loop` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Represents a single loop in the control flow graph. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Represents a single loop in the control flow graph.

Note that not all SCCs in the CFG are necessarily loops.

Definition at line 39 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>.

### getCanonicalInductionVariable() {#ae731e6e33c2f2a9a6ebd1d51886ce534}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>PHINode &#42; Loop::getCanonicalInductionVariable () const</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> to see if the loop has a canonical induction variable: an integer recurrence that starts at 0 and increments by one each time through the loop.

If so, return the phi node that corresponds to it.

The IndVarSimplify pass transforms loops to have a canonical induction variable.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00104">104</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00151">151</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getIncomingAndBackEdge() {#aeb36e1cc49a96f09e233c4cfe1e65fdf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Loop::getIncomingAndBackEdge (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;&amp; Incoming, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;&amp; Backedge) const</>}>
Obtain the unique incoming and back edge.

Return false if they are non-unique or the loop is dead; otherwise, return true.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00111">111</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00125">125</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.

### getInductionDescriptor() {#a87b4fb592be76abb594711e92bb35e5c}

<MemberDefinition

Get the loop induction descriptor for the loop induction variable.

Return true if the loop induction variable is found.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00259">259</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00334">334</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getInductionVariable() {#ab05e97728516fbeeaa9426496257c800}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>PHINode &#42; Loop::getInductionVariable (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp; SE) const</>}>
Return the loop induction variable if found, else return nullptr.

An instruction is considered as the loop induction variable if
<ul>
<li>it is an induction variable of the loop; and</li>
<li>it is used to determine the condition of the branch in the loop latch</li>
</ul>


Note: the induction variable doesn&#39;t need to be canonical, i.e. starts at zero and increments by one each time through the loop (but it can be).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00255">255</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00295">295</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getLocStr() {#a2b4746e455f9041187249483e7f5e5f5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="std::string Loop::getLocStr () const">
Return a string containing the debug location of the loop (file name + line number if present, otherwise module name).

Meant to be used for debug printing within LLVM&#95;DEBUG.

### getLoopGuardBranch() {#a580a6361a2bad87e6071ecc795bdae96}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>BranchInst &#42; Loop::getLoopGuardBranch () const</>}>
Return the loop guard branch, if it exists.

This currently only works on simplified loop, as it requires a preheader and a latch to identify the guard. It will work on loops of the form: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">GuardBB:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br cond1, Preheader, ExitSucc &lt;== GuardBranch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">Preheader:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-lvcompare-cpp-/#a1ad6686ca7dcf67bc791fff07fdf7818abf50d5e661106d0abe925af3c2e6f7e7">Header</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-lvcompare-cpp-/#a1ad6686ca7dcf67bc791fff07fdf7818abf50d5e661106d0abe925af3c2e6f7e7">Header</a>:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"> ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br Latch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">Latch:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br cond2, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-lvcompare-cpp-/#a1ad6686ca7dcf67bc791fff07fdf7818abf50d5e661106d0abe925af3c2e6f7e7">Header</a>, ExitBlock</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">ExitBlock:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br ExitSucc</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">ExitSucc:</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00290">290</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00368">368</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getLoopID() {#afbcd78588d5235f99698b5c30f591382}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MDNode &#42; Loop::getLoopID () const</>}>
Return the llvm.loop loop id metadata node for this loop if it is present.

If this loop contains the same llvm.loop metadata on each branch to the header then the node is returned. If any latch instruction does not contain llvm.loop or if multiple latches contain different nodes then 0 is returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00349">349</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00502">502</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.

### getStartLoc() {#a615131659002c10601eef598d42d025e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="DebugLoc Loop::getStartLoc () const">
Return the debug location of the start of this loop.

This looks for a BB terminating instruction with a known debug location by looking at the preheader and header blocks. If it cannot find a terminating instruction with location information, it returns an unknown location.

### isAnnotatedParallel() {#a5bce47fa5e8edaf4eef3ddc67a78193c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool Loop::isAnnotatedParallel () const">
Returns true if the loop is annotated parallel.

A parallel loop can be assumed to not contain any dependencies between iterations by the compiler. That is, any loop-carried dependency checking can be skipped completely when parallelizing the loop on the target machine. Thus, if the parallel loop information originates from the programmer, e.g. via the OpenMP parallel for pragma, it is the programmer&#39;s responsibility to ensure there are no loop-carried dependencies. The final execution order of the instructions across iterations is not guaranteed, thus, the end result might or might not implement actual concurrent execution of instructions across multiple iterations.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00341">341</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00565">565</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isAuxiliaryInductionVariable() {#afe702618f56478e67eb0f705efb648b6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Loop::isAuxiliaryInductionVariable (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &amp; AuxIndVar, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp; SE) const</>}>
Return true if the given <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> <code>AuxIndVar</code> is.

<ul>
<li>in the loop header</li>
<li>not used outside of the loop</li>
<li>incremented by a loop invariant step for each loop iteration</li>
<li>step instruction opcode should be add or sub Note: auxiliary induction variable is not required to be used in the conditional branch in the loop latch. (but it can be)</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00269">269</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00342">342</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.

### isRotatedForm() {#a94bf09763773a48bc03a0461fb572a0c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::Loop::isRotatedForm () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if the loop is in rotated form.

This does not check if the loop was rotated by loop rotation, instead it only checks if the loop is in rotated form (has a valid latch that exists the loop).

### makeLoopInvariant() {#ae58027d845fb948a63a8ff44851699d5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Loop::makeLoopInvariant (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, bool &amp; Changed, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; InsertPt=nullptr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssaupdater">MemorySSAUpdater</a> &#42; MSSAU=nullptr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42; SE=nullptr) const</>}>
If the given value is an instruction inside of the loop and it can be hoisted, do so to make it trivially loop-invariant.

Return true if <code>V</code> is already loop-invariant, and false if <code>V</code> can&#39;t be made loop-invariant. If <code>V</code> is made loop-invariant, <code>Changed</code> is set to true. This function can be used as a slightly more aggressive replacement for isLoopInvariant.

If InsertPt is specified, it is the point to hoist instructions to. If null, the terminator of the loop preheader is used.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00077">77</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00071">71</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

If InsertPt is specified, it is the point to hoist instructions to. If null, the terminator of the loop preheader is used.

### setLoopAlreadyUnrolled() {#ae27590daf21d575c9bb75c966fe256f2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void Loop::setLoopAlreadyUnrolled ()">
Add llvm.loop.unroll.disable to this loop&#39;s loop id metadata.

Remove existing unroll metadata and add unroll disable metadata to indicate the loop has already been unrolled. This prevents a loop from being unrolled more than is directed by a pragma if the loop unrolling pass is run more than once (which it generally is).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00365">365</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00538">538</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setLoopID() {#adf4be757fa30ca7fe3e8b119438100f0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Loop::setLoopID (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a> &#42; LoopID) const</>}>
Set the llvm.loop loop id metadata for this loop.

The LoopID metadata node will be added to each terminator instruction in the loop that branches to the loop header.

The LoopID metadata node should have one or more operands and the first operand should be the node itself.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h/#l00357">357</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopinfo-h">LoopInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp/#l00526">526</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopinfo-cpp">LoopInfo.cpp</a>.
